definition: to break/to snap/to cut off/to give up or abstain from sth/to judge/(usu. used in the negative) absolutely/definitely/decidedly

sentences.english: By virtue of its super quality, this product is often sold out in many areas.
sentences.chinese: 这种产品因其卓越的品质常常在许多地区卖到断货。

sentences.english: I know that he was told that the product was out of stock.
sentences.chinese: 我知道别人告诉过他这种产品断货了这件事。

definition: to sell out/to run out (of supplies)/deficient/lack of supplies
to sell strongly/to be in great demand
to buy frenetically/to snap up (bargains, dwindling supplies etc)
to be completely sold out/to sell out
merchandise or commodities available immediately after sale/merchandise in stock/available item/actuals (investment)/actual commodities
sales counter dedicated to a certain kind of product (e.g. alcohol)
to cut the price/to drive down the price/to get cheaper
